definition: to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-
doubtful/suspicious/variant of 擬|拟[ni3]/to emulate/to imitate

sentences.english: The essay is about the onomatopoeic words and mimicry words in Japanese, discuses their use and origin.
sentences.chinese: 本文论述了日语中的拟声词和拟态词的来源和用法。

sentences.english: The core of the ideophones are emphasized, if there is one.
sentences.chinese: 拟态词的中心语会用重点标记标出来。

sentences.english: Onomatopoeia and mimetic words are a striking feature of Japanese vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 拟声词和拟态词是日语词汇的突出特征。

sentences.english: There are plenty of onomatopoeia in both Chinese and Japanese .
sentences.chinese: 日语和汉语的拟声拟态词都极为丰富。

sentences.english: The reason why this probably happens is tied to the strategy behind the mimicry itself.
sentences.chinese: 这种情况会发生的原因跟产生拟态的策略是分不开的。

definition: main part/torso/the thing in itself/noumenon (object of purely intellectual perception according to Kant)
to spare time for a separate task/doppelgänger/sockpuppet (Internet slang)
to live in or on another organism as a parasite/to live by taking advantage of others/parasitism/parasitic
human shape/in human form/of human appearance/doll/puppet
